inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of perforated appendicitis at laparoscopy
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: CT scan showed evidence of acute perforated appendicitis with free fluid in the pelvis. Diagnostic laparoscopy revealed phlegmon with no other abdominal abnormalities.

inclusion.criterion: Development of a post-appendectomy abscess that is treated with percutaneous drainage.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are allergic to ampicillin
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, nausea and vomiting, febrile with tenderness, rebound tenderness and guarding on palpation.
